metadata.synopsis: The drow commander is a True Soul, sent to the goblin camp in order to instil some discipline in the goblins and lead their raids. She's already had one success - at the tavern - but the adventurers who infiltrated the goblin camp are her next targets. The Absolute believes they have something of value, and she must reclaim it. The players can tell her that the adventurers fled to the grove in which case she'll see the players as perfect candidates to help her infiltrate the place, having mistaken them for True Souls.

4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
4.text: I trust you have cleared your mind? I hunger for battle. We must find the sanctuary.
4.context: NodeContext: short-tempered, speaking to a subordinate

281.speaker: Player
281.text: I have business at Moonrise. Can you provide safe passage?
281.context: NodeContext: pleased - describing goblins coming to the service of her god

286.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
286.text: Yes - I suppose I might offer you passage. But first you will obey my command in Her mighty name.

227.speaker: Player
227.text: The prisoner gave up his secrets.
227.context: NodeContext: pleased - describing goblins coming to the service of her god

182.speaker: Player
182.text: Let me see your map. I'll show you where the grove is.
182.context: NodeContext: pleased - describing goblins coming to the service of her god

25.speaker: Player
25.text: How did a drow come to be commanding a tribe of goblins?
25.context: NodeContext: pleased - describing goblins coming to the service of her god

346.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
346.text: They are flocking to the Absolute. In sufficient numbers, they are an effective force. Expendable and willing.
346.context: NodeContext: pleased - describing goblins coming to the service of her god

246.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
246.text: Then do as you were ordered.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: I thought spiders were sacred to your kind, yet you use them for bloodsport?
230.context: NodeContext: with a sneer - talking about spiders, normally sacred to her people. but she worships a new god 'the Absolute' and has turned her back on the old ways

423.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
423.text: They are vermin - sacred only to the false goddess Lolth. She has no power here, among the Absolute's Chosen.
423.context: NodeContext: with a sneer - talking about spiders, normally sacred to her people. but she worships a new god 'the Absolute' and has turned her back on the old ways

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You denounce Lolth? Heretic - I'll kill you!

22.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
22.text: It is time to continue the hunt, True Soul. I hunger for battle.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I have business at Moonrise. Can you provide safe passage?

366.speaker: Player
366.text: You might stay hungry. I already dealt with some of the grove's inhabitants.

151.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
151.text: You started the slaughter without me? How selfish.

384.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
384.text: But we can still fight side by side. Together, we will destroy any who have not died or fled.

43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
43.text: I will gather my forces - we will reach the grove by next light.

226.speaker: Player
226.text: There's a problem - the druids have performed a ritual to seal the grove.

23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
23.text: And you allowed them to do this? You were ordered to expose them.

324.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
324.text: I will gather my forces nonetheless and reach the grove by next light.

350.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
350.text: Join me and my warband at the entrance. Either it falls, or you do.

383.speaker: Player
383.text: I'm ready. The grove will fall.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: So do I. I'm here to kill you.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: You are too beholden to zealotry, True Soul. I must end your hunt here.

48.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
48.text: I do not have time for interruptions from underlings.

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *As she turns to you, her thoughts mingle with yours, a cold hand caressing your brain.*
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: the drow turns and looks at the player, studying themNodeContext: unnerved

181.text: *The chamber melts away to reveal a dark, endless nowhere. In it, you see a vision - the drow listens as a pale-eyed young woman whispers in her ear.*
181.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sees a vision of Minthara with Orin, one of the Absolute's chosen.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic blocked until Orin asset/voice available.

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *The chamber melts away to reveal a dark, endless nowhere. In it, you see a vision - the drow listens as a pale-eyed young woman whispers in her ear.*
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sees a vision of Minthara with Orin, one of the Absolute's chosen.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic blocked until Orin asset/voice available.

271.speaker: Narrator
271.text: *The chamber melts away to reveal a dark, endless nowhere. In it, you see a vision - the drow listens as a pale-eyed young woman whispers in her ear.*
271.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *One of those the voice spoke of. One of the Chosen. The vision fades away...*
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

321.text: A True Soul? Praise be, sister. Are you here to join my hunt?
321.context: NodeContext: wry smile, sizing up a possible ally

192.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
192.text: A True Soul? Praise be, sister. Are you here to join my hunt?
192.context: NodeContext: wry smile, sizing up a possible ally

385.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
385.text: A True Soul? Do not think that means we are equals, jaluk. Are you here to join my hunt?
385.context: NodeContext: insulting - speaking to a male drow who she sees as beneath her. 'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

204.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
204.text: A half-drow, but a True Soul? The Absolute's blessings may atone for the impurities of your blood.
204.context: NodeContext: disgusted - speaking to an elf player and has a hatred of them. 'darthiir' (dar-FEAR) is a derogatory term for an elf

139.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
139.text: A True Soul in such a grotesque form? The Absolute has a place in Her heart even for darthiir.
139.context: NodeContext: disgusted - speaking to an elf player and has a hatred of them. 'darthiir' (dar-FEAR) is a derogatory term for an elf

344.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
344.text: Her heart is more generous than mine. Join my hunt, faerie. And obey me.
344.context: NodeContext: sinister - 'faerie' is a derogatory way of referring to the player's race (an elf)

130.speaker: Player
130.text: I met True Soul Nere in the Underdark. He warned me against working with you.
130.context: NodeContext: cold, threatening - we're on her turf and she wants to know exactly why

120.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
120.text: Did he, now? Let me guess: the snivelling brat's failed his duty. Nothing if not expected.

311.speaker: Player
311.text: I have business at Moonrise. Can you provide safe passage?
311.context: NodeContext: cold, threatening - we're on her turf and she wants to know exactly why

259.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
259.text: Yes. I suppose I might offer passage. But first - we hunt.

214.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
214.text: Prove yourself worthy, and you will have what you seek.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I'm on a hunt of my own. I'm looking for a druid named Halsin.
115.context: NodeContext: cold, threatening - we're on her turf and she wants to know exactly why

26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
26.text: Interesting. What do you know of this druid?
26.context: NodeContext: cold, threatening - we're on her turf and she wants to know exactly why

377.speaker: Player
377.text: I visited his grove. Many of the inhabitants are already dead.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I visited his grove - but the druids there have cast a protective spell over the place.

29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
29.text: Perfect. This grove is the place I am seeking. Show me where it is, and we will destroy it together.

155.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
155.text: There is a weapon the Absolute seeks - I'm sure those wretches have it hidden away there. We will find it, amongst the dead and the ashes.
155.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *Her excitement is palpable. She lingers on thoughts of victory, of unbelievers' blood spilled...*
118.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *...and of the weapon. She will seize it, in the Absolute's name.*
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

387.speaker: Player
387.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon the Absolute seeks - it's the artefact that she carries. The same one that protected you as you entered the goblin camp.*
387.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *You feel Shadowheart's anxiety. The weapon the Absolute seeks - it's the artefact that she carries. The same one that protected you as you entered the goblin camp.*
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart steals a glance to Tav, her expression tight, apprehensive. The image of her undulates slightly - a mindmeld.

360.speaker: Narrator
360.text: *Her mind focuses - the cultists cannot discover that the weapon they seek is within their grasp.*
360.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's eyes flick over to the hobgoblin.

258.speaker: Player
258.context: NodeContext: annoyed with self - just stumbled into a huge mistake

373.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
373.context: NodeContext: annoyed with self - just stumbled into a huge mistake

201.speaker: Player
201.context: NodeContext: annoyed with self - just stumbled into a huge mistake

409.speaker: Player
409.context: NodeContext: annoyed with self - just stumbled into a huge mistake

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: You'll think of no better, I assure you.

414.speaker: Player
414.text: And endanger the entire grove? It's too risky.

301.speaker: Lae'zel
301.text: Even a kith'rak might struggle to slay them here. At the grove, we have an advantage.

196.speaker: Player
196.text: Quiet. We'll handle this my way.

367.speaker: Lae'zel
367.text: Precisely the way I meant to avoid.

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *The drow's mind closes around yours, her bloodlust like needles in your skull.*
3.context: NodeContext: annoyed with self - just stumbled into a huge mistake

243.speaker: Player
243.text: The tieflings should be warned. Together, you can outnumber her warband.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: Perhaps you can misdirect her... or kill her.

447.speaker: Player
447.text: Leading her to the tieflings might doom them... but it would earn her trust.

255.speaker: Player
255.text: The grove's inhabitants are weak - it's ready to fall.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Even with the grove's numbers depleted, dealing with her there may be safer than fighting here.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: The druids' magic protects the grove, but she may be able to break through.

94.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
94.text: My patience wears thin, True Soul. The hunt must begin.

374.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
374.text: Show me the grove. Be my eyes.

393.speaker: Narrator
393.text: *You realise that the weapon the drow's mind dwells upon is the gith artefact you carry. You cannot let her discover it - no matter what.*
393.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

167.speaker: Narrator
167.text: *You suddenly feel a strange anxiety take hold - not your own, but that of the gith artefact you carry. Somehow, it's afraid...*
167.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player glances to their side, as if sensing the box

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *You attune your mind to it. The artefact does not want to part from you. It does not want to fall into the Absolute's clutches.*
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances from their side to Minthara

334.speaker: Player
334.text: I've heard rumours that he's a very powerful healer.

420.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
420.text: There is no power except for the Absolute. If you are sick, speak to the goblins' priestess - she, too, is a True Soul.

307.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
307.text: I have not seen this druid, but he harbours worshippers of a false god in a hidden grove nearby.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: I have orders to capture him.
199.context: NodeContext: smug - telling us she carried out or orders before we even arrived

408.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
408.text: If you were sent here to hunt him, perhaps you can help me.
408.context: NodeContext: smug - telling us she carried out or orders before we even arrived

337.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
337.text: If you were sent here to hunt him, perhaps you can help me.
337.context: NodeContext: smug - telling us she carried out or orders before we even arrived

75.text: Orders from whom? This is my command, and if you were sent here, I would have been told to expect you.

148.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
148.text: Orders from whom? This is my command, and if you were sent here, I would have been told to expect you.

174.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
174.text: The druid makes his home in a nearby sanctuary where his followers worship a false god.

190.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
190.text: I intend to find it, and destroy it.

187.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
187.text: Send her to the grove. Better to face them on familiar ground.
187.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

213.speaker: Player
213.text: Send her to the grove. Better to face them on familiar ground.
213.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

441.speaker: Player
441.text: Send her to the grove. Better to face them on familiar ground.
441.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

234.speaker: Lae'zel
234.text: Send her to the grove. Better to face them on familiar ground.
234.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

446.speaker: Player
446.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

172.speaker: Player
172.text: And endanger the entire grove? It's too risky.
172.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

303.speaker: Player
303.text: Enough. Speak only to me, True Soul. The hunt must begin.
303.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

65.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
65.text: Enough. Speak only to me, True Soul. The hunt must begin.
65.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

256.speaker: Player
256.text: Nothing makes the blood hotter. Let's hunt.
256.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

369.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
369.text: I would expect nothing less, jaluk. Perhaps even you are more capable than these goblins.
369.context: NodeContext: cold, arrogant -  'jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow

331.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
331.text: Yes, sister. Together, we shall burn it to the ground.

317.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
317.text: And when we destroy the trappings of this false god, the Absolute will reward us with such power.
317.context: NodeContext: the Absolute is her god - she's in awe of that god

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Why not send a goblin scouting party?

124.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
124.text: The last I sent did not return. Dead at the hands of those they seek, no doubt.

206.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
206.text: I would take greater pleasure in killing them myself than in sending them to die in the woods.

216.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
216.text: And the occasional mass execution does wonders for discipline.

13.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
13.text: One. We captured a human who knows exactly where it is.

47.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
47.text: He's been resilient but he'll talk...
47.context: NodeContext: cold, with a spark of malice

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Enough. Speak only to me while you are in my presence. The hunt must begin soon.

391.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
391.text: Enough. Speak only to me while you are in my presence. The hunt must begin soon.

325.speaker: Player
325.text: I killed a lot of them already. I couldn't help myself.

269.speaker: Player
269.text: The place you seek is a grove - many of the inhabitants are already dead.

323.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
323.text: If you played a part in thinning their numbers, I commend your efforts.

232.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
232.text: Together, we will slaughter any who remain.

371.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
371.text: Join me and my warband at the grove. It will fall.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: The place you seek is a grove - the druids there have performed a ritual to protect it.

287.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
287.text: And you believe their god's roots and branches can stand against the Absolute's fury?

342.speaker: Player
342.text: I can be very persuasive - I'll visit the prisoner.

2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
2.text: Excellent - be sure not to kill him before he talks.

359.speaker: Player
359.text: I spoke to the prisoner. He told me everything.

451.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
451.text: Tell me what you know. The Absolute will reward us with such power if we find this place.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Point to the location of the grove on her map.

263.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
263.text: So close! Their fate is sealed - and you will be instrumental in the slaughter.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Place your finger on a patch of forest, far from the grove.

80.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
80.text: Fool. You have fallen for his lies. We know that area well - there is nothing hidden there.

222.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
222.text: Fool. You have fallen for his lies. We know that area well - there is nothing hidden there.

448.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
448.text: We will have to do this the hard way. Scour the area and hunt them down, then report back to me.

60.text: You are a poor liar. I do not know why you are protecting them, and I do not care.

146.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
146.text: You are a poor liar. I do not know why you are protecting them, and I do not care.

354.speaker: Player
354.text: We don't need the prisoner. I already know the place you're looking for.

279.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
279.text: You are sure? And how did you find it?

71.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
71.text: Excellent. Now show it to me! Be my eyes...

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *Her mind enters yours, a splinter of ice piercing your memories.*

399.speaker: Narrator
399.text: *Tiefling faces flicker into view as she attempts to learn the grove's location.*
399.context: NodeContext: unnerved, we're having our mind read

382.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
382.text: Destroying this place is the Absolute's will. Would you defy Her?

298.speaker: Player
298.text: You'll have to go through me to get to the grove.

294.speaker: Player
294.text: Do not question me. I am the Absolute's Chosen.

427.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
427.text: If that is true, killing you will prove my superiority.

327.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
327.text: If that is true, killing you will prove my superiority.

438.text: Your connection to the Absolute is strong... but do not think it will protect you if you cross me.

460.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
460.text: Your connection to the Absolute is strong... but do not think it will protect you if you cross me.

285.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
285.text: Go. Serve our god as you must. But when your work is done, I will be waiting. Together, we will burn that place.

470.speaker: Player
470.text: The Absolute chose me. I do as I please.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: We're both drow. The Absolute shouldn't come between us.

205.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
205.text: I would sacrifice a thousand drow if the Absolute commanded it! You will be the first!

368.speaker: Player
368.text: I refuse to betray my own kind.

97.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
97.text: Faith is stronger than blood, traitor!

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Allow her to read your thoughts.

404.speaker: Narrator
404.text: *She sees the entrance to the grove as the adventurers retreat inside, joining the tieflings...*

275.speaker: Narrator
275.text: *...and then sees vines covering the entrance, sealing the grove from the inside.*

51.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
51.text: The druids have called on their god to protect the place. No matter.

200.speaker: Narrator
200.text: *...and then sees the corpses of those who have already died.*

30.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
30.text: I see the slaughter has already begun. We will eliminate those who remain together, True Soul.

173.speaker: Narrator
173.text: *...and then smiles serenely as blood and shadow spread like stains across your memory, erasing all that live there.*

343.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
343.text: The cowards found refuge among the desperate. Perfect.

396.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
396.text: If the inhabitants do not realise you are the knife at their throats, we can use that against them.

375.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
375.text: Go to their refuge and make your way inside. As a friend.

465.speaker: Player
465.text: That won't be necessary. Many of the inhabitants are already dead.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: There's no way inside - the druids have performed a ritual to seal the place.

370.speaker: Player
370.text: I prefer to face my enemies rather than stabbing them in the back.

180.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
180.text: How noble. I prefer to win.

419.speaker: Player
419.text: I don't have the most trustworthy face.

253.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
253.text: They're half-devil refugees... Nobody wants them.

329.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
329.text: A drowning creature will cling to a blade if nothing else is offered. Be that blade.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: They'll die thinking I'm their hero.

54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
54.text: Exquisite. The Absolute chose well when She chose you.

37.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
37.text: I will gather a raiding party and move into position.

207.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
207.text: You will open the gates from the inside when the time is right to strike.

364.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
364.text: We will cleanse the place of infidels and burn it to the ground in the Absolute's name.

402.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
402.text: And then we will be the first among Her favourites.

314.speaker: Narrator
314.text: *The masterful painting she depicts of the massacre awakens you hungrily.*

390.speaker: Player
390.text: How delightful, I'm very eager to begin.

235.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
235.text: Control yourself - you are as uncouth as the goblins. The slaughter at the Grove will not begin until you have prepared the way.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Reject these dreams of a bloodbath.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: I've done enough. The battle is yours to fight.

355.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
355.text: I do not intend to lead a suicidal charge. The goblins are expendable; I am not.

231.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
231.text: The Absolute brought you here for a reason - to throw open those gates so we can crush our enemies.

144.speaker: Player
144.context: NodeContext: zelaous and on the last phrase, slightly flirtatious

435.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
435.text: Good. Marshalling the goblins is no simple matter, but my warband will be ready to attack by next light.
435.context: NodeContext: zelaous and on the last phrase, slightly flirtatious

291.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
291.text: And when they are dead, the Absolute will reward your faith. As will I.
291.context: NodeContext: zelaous and on the last phrase, slightly flirtatious

479.speaker: Player
479.text: You're right. I'll see you at the grove.

429.speaker: Player
429.text: The Absolute requires my presence at Moonrise. Can you provide safe passage?

273.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
273.text: Yes. I suppose I might offer you passage. But first you will raze the grove and honour our mistress.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I have other business to attend to.

228.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
228.text: Take care of it quickly. You are needed here, and my patience wears thin.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: If I do this, I expect to be rewarded.

176.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
176.text: You are honoured to serve a cause - a god. You will earn Her love, and the power that flows from that love.

197.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
197.text: What greater reward could there be?

338.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
338.text: We are servants of the one true god, not mercenaries.

223.speaker: Player
223.text: You're right. The Absolute's love is enough.
223.context: NodeContext: shouting in praise of her god

274.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
274.context: NodeContext: shouting in praise of her god

12.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
12.text: I will gather my warband and reach the grove by next light.

411.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
411.text: You must make your way inside. Once I am in position, on your signal, we break them.

241.speaker: Player
241.context: NodeContext: not shouted - smiling, in praise of her god "the absolute"

32.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
32.context: NodeContext: not shouted - smiling, in praise of her god "the absolute"

308.speaker: Wyll
308.text: Gods damn it all. To the grove - quickly. We can't let it fall to these vicious bastards.

466.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
466.context: NodeContext: not shouted - smiling, in praise of her god "the absolute"

312.speaker: Player
312.text: Without gold, I can't serve the Absolute efficiently.

425.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
425.text: Fine. I will share what I have. But keep it to yourself; the goblins would squander it.

351.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
351.text: Fine. I will share what I have. But keep it to yourself; the goblins would squander it.

284.text: Kill the tieflings and take what you need.

475.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
475.text: Kill the tieflings and take what you need.

219.speaker: Player
219.context: NodeContext: player has threatened her - shocked by their bravery

212.speaker: Player
212.text: No. This ends now, and so do you.
212.context: NodeContext: player has threatened her - shocked by their bravery

64.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
64.text: You would dare...? Guards - to me!
64.context: NodeContext: player has threatened her - shocked by their bravery

267.speaker: Player
267.text: I don't need your fledgling god's favour. My oath is all I need.

245.speaker: Player
245.text: Obscure memories of the grove with images of half-remembered places.

422.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
422.text: I see only fragments. Your mind is confused - do what you must to clear it.

195.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
195.text: I see only fragments. Your mind is confused - do what you must to clear it.

128.text: Your thoughts are... veiled? Why do you protect these devilkin?

175.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
175.text: Your thoughts are veiled. Are you protecting these creatures because they share your blood?

459.speaker: Player
459.text: They're innocent, and no danger to you.

233.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
233.text: You defy me... You defy the Absolute! Traitor!

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Protect them? Never. My memories are yours.

439.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
439.text: That is hard to believe - your mind is a maze of misdirection.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I'm sorry... I stopped by the party. The drink's clouding my mind.

463.text: Pathetic. You are polluting the power the Absolute has granted you.

117.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
117.text: Pathetic. You are polluting the power the Absolute has granted you.

221.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
221.text: Purge yourself of these intoxicants, and come back to me when you are capable of serving as you should.

137.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
137.text: No. There is intent behind this deception - and you will pay for it with your life.

184.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
184.text: No. There is intent behind this deception - and you will pay for it with your life.

134.text: Untangle them, or you are worthless to me. My patience wears thin.

183.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
183.text: Untangle them, or you are worthless to me. My patience wears thin.

288.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
288.text: Assist the goblins with their interrogation - the prisoner can tell us what you cannot.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Relent, and open your mind to her.

49.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
49.text: Your allegiance should be to me and the Absolute. While you hold on to your past, you are worthless.

426.speaker: Player
426.text: You'd slaughter them on the whim of a capricious god. I find that... distasteful.

464.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
464.text: Praise be. And now, through Her will, you can be my eyes.

376.speaker: Player
376.text: We don't need the prisoner. I already know the place you're looking for.

415.speaker: Player
415.text: My hunt ends here - you're my prey.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: The hunt of your ill-begotten god ends here, True Soul.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: And endanger the entire grove? It's too risky.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Quiet. We'll handle this my way.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Share in her dream of a dance of death.

365.speaker: Player
365.text: Promise yourself: you will save them. From her, and you.

421.speaker: Player
421.text: The tieflings should be warned. Together, you can outnumber her warband.

332.speaker: Player
332.text: Leading her to the tieflings might doom them... but it would earn you her trust.

345.speaker: Player
345.text: Perhaps you can misdirect her... or kill her.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: The grove's inhabitants are weak - it's ready to fall.

166.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
166.text: Speak, True Soul. The hunt must begin soon.

339.speaker: Player
339.text: Even with the grove's numbers depleted, dealing with her there may be safer than fighting here.

472.speaker: Player
472.text: The druids' magic protects the grove, but she may be able to break through.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: I've already found the place - it's a druids' grove, not far from here.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: I know the place - it's east of here. A grove of some kind.

158.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
158.text: You are sure? Show it to me. Be my eyes.

400.speaker: Narrator
400.text: *Images of the battle at the gate shimmer into view, along with the adventurers pleading to be let inside.*
400.context: NodeContext: unnerved, somebody is reading our mind

209.speaker: Player
209.text: The prisoner talked, with a little encouragement. I know where the others are hiding.

372.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
372.text: I would expect nothing less. Together, we shall burn it to the ground.

362.speaker: Player
362.text: What's so important about this sanctuary?

179.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
179.text: Destroying it will demonstrate our power. Soon, all false gods will cower before the Absolute.

461.speaker: Player
461.text: I know the place you're looking for - it's a druids' grove.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: This ends now - so does your life.

424.speaker: Player
424.text: Quiet. We'll handle this my way.

386.speaker: Narrator
386.text: *She is seeking the grove you visited. Already, you feel her mind closing around yours.*
386.context: NodeContext: musing over options, somewhat panicked

401.speaker: Player
401.text: Luring her to the grove might expose her, provided you forewarn the tieflings.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: If she finds the grove, everyone there will die. You need to throw her off the trail.

378.speaker: Player
378.text: Revealing its location might doom the tieflings - but it'd earn you her trust.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: The grove's inhabitants are weak - it's ready to fall.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Even with the grove's numbers depleted, dealing with her there may be safer than fighting here.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: The druids' magic protects the grove, but she may be able to break through.

322.speaker: Player
322.text: I require something from you - a lyre, capable of summoning a guide.

1.text: Take it - I do not need a guide, I need a hunter. Will you join me?

250.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
250.text: Take it - I do not need a guide, I need a hunter. Will you join me?

161.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
161.text: You need to prove your value before I give you anything. Join my hunt - that will show your worth.

450.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
450.text: Worshippers of a false god. Their existence is an insult to the Absolute's claim on this region.

140.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
140.text: The thief whimpering in our dungeon tried to flee to their sanctuary.

145.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
145.text: We will continue to remove parts of him until he tells us exactly where it is.

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I have my own business to take care of.

28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
28.text: This tribe is mine to command. If you have business here, then you report to me.

333.speaker: Player
333.text: How do you know I'm a True Soul?
333.context: NodeContext: mildly suspicious - the Absolute is her god and she's speaking to someone she believes to be chosen by that god. they said something unexpected

70.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
70.text: Why do you ask? Surely you feel the Absolute moving through me - just as I feel Her in you.
70.context: NodeContext: mildly suspicious - the Absolute is her god and she's speaking to someone she believes to be chosen by that god. they said something unexpected

147.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
147.text: Now - let us hunt together, sister. In Her name.
147.context: NodeContext: 'Her name' is a reference to the speaker's god. She thinks we worship the same god. Sister is because we are of the same race.

125.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
125.text: Now - you must obey me and hunt, jaluk. In Her name.
125.context: NodeContext: insulting - jaluk' (jah-LUCK) is a derogatory term for a male drow.

381.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
381.text: Why She chose iblith such as you, I cannot say. But we must hunt together.
381.context: NodeContext: insulting, disgusted - ‘Iblith’ (ib-LIFF) is a very insulting term for an elf

260.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
260.text: Now, you must hunt with me. In Her name.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Why is a drow commanding a tribe of goblins?
129.context: NodeContext: describing her goblin minions. malicious amusement on final phrase

81.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
81.text: They are servants of the Absolute. In sufficient numbers, they are an effective force. Expendable and willing.
81.context: NodeContext: describing her goblin minions. malicious amusement on final phrase

302.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
302.text: But they do not have the wits to lead this hunt with me. Do you?
302.context: NodeContext: 'they' are her goblin minions - she's appraising us and wondering if we're more capable than they are

203.speaker: Player
203.text: I'm on a hunt, too - you're my prey.
203.context: NodeContext: shocked, ready to attack: ‘Iblith’ (ib-LIFF) is a very insulting term for an elf

304.speaker: Player
304.text: Join you? I'm here to kill you.
304.context: NodeContext: shocked, ready to attack: ‘Iblith’ (ib-LIFF) is a very insulting term for an elf

313.speaker: Player
313.text: Obey you? I'm here to kill you.
313.context: NodeContext: shocked, ready to attack: ‘Iblith’ (ib-LIFF) is a very insulting term for an elf

316.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
316.text: You would dare...? The darkness will take you, iblith!
316.context: NodeContext: shocked, ready to attack: ‘Iblith’ (ib-LIFF) is a very insulting term for an elf

86.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
86.text: A True Soul? Praise be. Are you here to join my hunt?

50.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
50.text: The goblins tell me that you extracted a confession from our prisoner, True Soul.
50.context: NodeContext: short-tempered, speaking to a subordinate

138.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
138.text: Without your help, they would have extracted nothing but screams and blood.

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *Her thoughts mingle with yours, a cold hand caressing your brain.*

413.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
413.text: You are a True Soul, jaluk? Perhaps you are worthy to assist me.

188.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
188.text: You are a True Soul, sister? It is good to have your assistance.

349.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
349.text: It is time for the raid to begin. The grove, and those who are hiding there, will fall.

412.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
412.text: A True Soul in such a grotesque form? The Absolute has a place in Her heart even for darthiir.

315.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
315.text: You are a True Soul? Little wonder that you serve me so well.

91.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
91.text: I have been expecting you. The goblins tell me that you forced a confession from our prisoner.
91.context: NodeContext: short-tempered, speaking to a subordinate

262.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
262.text: I trust you have found the sanctuary? I hunger for battle.
262.context: NodeContext: short-tempered, speaking to a subordinate

445.speaker: Player
445.text: I visited the grove you are looking for. Many of its inhabitants are already dead.
445.context: NodeContext: irritated - talking about her goblin minions letting a prisoner escape

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I visited the grove - the druids have performed a ritual to seal it from intruders.
38.context: NodeContext: irritated - talking about her goblin minions letting a prisoner escape

33.speaker: Player
33.context: NodeContext: irritated - talking about her goblin minions letting a prisoner escape

318.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
318.text: These creatures have failed me again? I will deal with those responsible later.
318.context: NodeContext: irritated - talking about her goblin minions letting a prisoner escape

268.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
268.text: Did he tell you where his friends are hiding before he fled?

119.speaker: Player
119.context: NodeContext: sceptical - suspects she's not been told the truth; preparing to telepathically enter our mind

142.speaker: Player
142.text: No, but I've seen the place myself.
142.context: NodeContext: sceptical - suspects she's not been told the truth; preparing to telepathically enter our mind

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I'm sorry. I didn't get anything out of him.
113.context: NodeContext: sceptical - suspects she's not been told the truth; preparing to telepathically enter our mind

109.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
109.text: Perhaps... but your thoughts are troubled. Show me everything you have seen.
109.context: NodeContext: sceptical - suspects she's not been told the truth; preparing to telepathically enter our mind

467.speaker: Narrator
467.text: *Her mind enters yours, a splinter of ice piercing your memories.*

277.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
277.text: Your scouting party has not returned, and half of the intruders escaped your guards.
277.context: CinematicNodeContext: talking to goblin warchief rather than the player, frustrated with themNodeContext: talking to goblin warchief rather than the player, frustrated with them

319.speaker: Rozzak
319.context: CinematicNodeContext: talking to drow commander rather than playerNodeContext: frightened subordinate

68.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
68.text: Until their sanctuary is found, I will take something precious from you every hour that passes.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: talking to goblin warchiefNodeContext: cool, calm, sinister

121.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
121.text: A trinket... a tongue... a limb.

272.speaker: Rozzak
272.text: I ain't no use without my limbs! The lads'll make the prisoner squeal soon enough, I swear!

473.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
473.text: Silence now, creature. Or I will silence you forever.

296.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
296.text: I do not have time for interruptions, sister.

462.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
462.text: Report. And make it quick - organising these creatures tests my patience.
462.context: NodeContext: short-tempered, speaking to a subordinate
